1:
God, I am very confident in you.\q1 I will sing to praise you.
\q2 It is an honor to wake up and praise you.
\q1
2:
I will arise before the sun rises,\q2 and I will praise you while I play my harp and my lyre.


\q1
3:
I prayed, "Yahweh, I will thank you among all the people groups;\q2 I will sing to praise you among the nations
\q1
4:
because your faithful love for us reaches up to the heavens,\q2 and you are as faithful in keeping your promises as the clouds are high above the earth.


\q1
5:
Yahweh, show in the heavens that you are very great!\q2 Show your glory to people all over the earth!
\q1
6:
Answer our prayers and, by your powe,r help us to defeat our enemies\q1 so that we, the people whom you love, may be saved."


\q1
7:
Yahweh answered our prayers and spoke from his temple, saying, "Because I have conquered your enemies, I will joyfully divide the city of Shechem,\q2 and I will distribute among my people the land in the Valley of Succoth.
\q1
10:
Because we want to attack the people of Edom,\q1 who will lead my army to their capital city that has strong walls around it?


\q
11:
God, we do not want you to abandon us;\q2 we want you to go with us when our army marches out to fight our enemies.
\q1
12:
We need you to help us when we fight against our enemies\q2 because the help that humans can give us is worthless.
\q1
13: But with you helping us, we shall win;\q2 you will enable us to defeat our enemies.
